org.jcvi.jillion.fasta.nt

Class FaiNucleotideWriterBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.fasta.nt.FaiNucleotideWriterBuilder

  • public final class FaiNucleotideWriterBuilder
extends Object
    Class that will create a Fasta Index file (.fai file) from an already existing fasta file.
    Author:
    dkatzel
    Since:
    5.1

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FaiNucleotideWriterBuilder(File inputFasta)
      Create a new Builder object that will write a fai file for the given input fasta file.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      File build()
      Parse the input fasta file and write out a new fai file using the configuration given.
      FaiNucleotideWriterBuilder charset(Charset charset)
      Change the Charset used when writing the output fai file.

      Change the end of line character(s) used for each line of the output fai file.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • FaiNucleotideWriterBuilder

        public FaiNucleotideWriterBuilder(File inputFasta)
                           throws IOException
        Create a new Builder object that will write a fai file for the given input fasta file. By default, the output fai file to be written will follow Samtools naming conventions and be named $inputFasta#getName().fai and will be written to the same directory where the inputFasta is location.
        Parameters:
        inputFasta - the input fasta file to parse; must exist and can not be null. May be compressed using any method supported by InputStreamSupplier.forFile(File).
        Throws:
        IOException - if inputFasta does not exist or is not readable.
        NullPointerException - if inputFasta is null.

    • Method Detail

      • outputFile

        public FaiNucleotideWriterBuilder outputFile(File outputFai)
        Change the output fai file to be written to the given output file. If this method is not called, then this writer will follow Samtools naming conventions and be named $inputFasta#getName().fai and will be written to the same directory where the inputFasta is location.
        Parameters:
        outputFai - the output file to write to; can not be null. If the file or parent directories do not exist,they will be created during build().
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if eol is null.

      • eol

        public FaiNucleotideWriterBuilder eol(String eol)
        Change the end of line character(s) used for each line of the output fai file. If this method is not specified, then the system default character(s) are used.
        Parameters:
        eol - the eol character to use, can not be null.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if eol is null.

      • charset

        public FaiNucleotideWriterBuilder charset(Charset charset)
        Change the Charset used when writing the output fai file. If this method is not specified, then the system default is used.
        Parameters:
        charset - the Charset to use, can not be null.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if charset is null.

      • build

        public File build()
           throws IOException
        Parse the input fasta file and write out a new fai file using the configuration given.
        Returns:
        the output fai File that was written; will never be null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there was a problem parsing the input fasta file or writing the output fai file.
